'Clostridium' is a genus of Gram-positive bacteria, belonging to the Firmicutes.
They are obligate anaerobes capable of producing endospores. Individual cells are
rod-shaped, which gives them their name, from the Greek kloster (ÎºÎ»ÏÏÏÎ®Ï) or
spindle. These characteristics traditionally defined the genus; however many species originally classified as Clostridium have been
reclassified in other genera.
